attributes.action: Ban neonicotinoid pesticides that harm  bees and other pollinators in the UK
attributes.background: Use existing legislation or new legislation to ban to make illegal the use of neonicotinoid pesticides and  other associated agents that harm and hinder bees and such other pollinators absolutely Enshrine the same for giving Farming Subsidies UK, agreeing Farming Trade Deals, giving Foreign Farm Aid
attributes.additional_details: If bees and other pollinators are harmed by the use of neonicotinoid pesticides and such agents that will impact directly the pollination of crops flora and deplete fauna. If allowed it would create food shortages and drive humanity to rely on the use of GM crops. Government know the science and harm that neonicotinoid pesticides cause to bees and other pollinators and supported restrictions on them across the EU prior to Brexit. Do not derogate now enshrine it within  UK Law post Brexit.

attributes.action: Reverse government decision to allow the use of bee-killing pesticides!
attributes.background:
If bees die, we die. 
Bees are essential to the natural world and now we’ve left the EU, the UK government has decided to allow the use of EU-banned pesticide Neonicotinoid Thiamethoxam on crops. This pesticide is LETHAL to bees and other pollinators. Stop the use of Neonicotinoids on crops!
attributes.additional_details: Neonicotinoids poisons the pollen, making it deadly to bees. Research suggests that the poison then moves up the food chain, killing birds as well. Neonicotinoids are banned in several countries due to links with bee deaths. Please ban the use of neonics on crops in the UK too!

attributes.action: Reverse the approval for farmers in the UK to use a harmful pesticide for bees.
attributes.background: Find an alternative solution to the pesticide product (containing neonicotinoid thiamethoxam) which has been given a ‘limited and controlled’ emergency authorisation for farmers to use in the UK treatment of sugar beet seed in 2021.
attributes.additional_details: The Government is aware of the clear harm that neonicotinoid pesticides cause to bees and other pollinators and just 3 years ago supported restrictions on them across the European Union. Neonicotinoids pose a significant environmental risk – particularly to our bees and other pollinators – and over the last decade hundreds of thousands of people across the UK have called for better protection of our bees, and for these highly toxic pesticides to be banned.

attributes.additional_details: Neonicotinoids have been banned in the U.K. as an EU member since 2018 following studies which showed a link between the use of these products in farming and a decrease in bee reproduction when using these pesticides. Please roll over these protections in order to protect the bee population of the U.K. and avoid setting a precedent for other harmful products to be used in the future.

attributes.action: Ban the production and use of Neonicotinoid pesticides
attributes.background: Environment secretary George Eustice has agreed to let a product containing the neonicotinoid thiamethoxam to treat sugar beet seed this year in an effort to protect the crop from a virus. This will be devastating for our bee population. Ban the production and usage of all Neonicotinoid pesticides.
attributes.additional_details:
Neonicotinoids pose a significant environmental risk, particularly to bees and other pollinators.

A third of the UK bee population is thought to have vanished in a decade, yet up to three-quarters of crop species are pollinated by bees, studies show. 

A 2017 study of 33 oilseed rape sites in the UK, Germany and Hungary found a link between higher levels of neonicotinoid residues and lower bee reproduction, with fewer queens in bumblebee hives and fewer egg cells in solitary bee nests.
